thread.title: Breast and ovarian cancers may be linked to sense of smell study suggests
thread.title_full: Breast and ovarian cancers may be linked to sense of smell study suggests

title: Breast and ovarian cancers may be linked to sense of smell study suggests
text:
Breast and ovarian cancers may be linked to sense of smell, study suggests 
The Independent Friday 23rd October, 2015 
A better sense of smell may be linked to a higher risk of certain types of cancer, a new study has suggested. 
Building on the observation that the menstrual cycles of female roomates often synchronise, researchers found connections between periods, breast and ovarian cancer risk, and smell. 
The team at the University of North Carolina Keck Medicine School assessed the oestrous cycle - equivalent to the human menstrual cycle - of mice carrying a gene mutation known to heighten the risk of the two forms of cancer. 
They found that the oestrous cycle was more stimulated by scent than n...
